slides.title: 1. Connecting the Dots
info: Steve Jobs shares his story about dropping out of college.
He highlights the importance of following curiosity and intuition.
His calligraphy class at Reed College influenced typography in the Macintosh.
slides.audio: Steve Jobs reflects on how dropping out of college allowed him to explore his interests freely. One notable example is his calligraphy class, which later shaped the typography of the Macintosh. He emphasizes that it's impossible to connect the dots looking forward, but looking backward, everything makes sense.

slides.title: 2. Love and Loss
info: Jobs recounts being fired from Apple, the company he founded.
He started NeXT and Pixar, marking a new creative phase.
His return to Apple brought innovation and personal fulfillment.
slides.audio: Steve Jobs shares how being fired from Apple was a transformative experience. It led to the creation of NeXT and Pixar, culminating in his eventual return to Apple. He stresses the importance of loving what you do, as it provides the resilience needed to overcome challenges.

slides.title: 3. Facing Death
info: Jobs discusses his experience with a cancer diagnosis.
He reflects on the inevitability of death and its clarifying power.
He encourages living authentically and following one's heart.
slides.audio: Steve Jobs opens up about his battle with cancer and how it reinforced his perspective on life and death. He explains that accepting mortality helps strip away fears and external pressures, allowing for a life guided by intuition and passion.

slides.title: 4. Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish
info: Jobs shares a farewell message inspired by the Whole Earth Catalog.
He urges graduates to remain curious and adventurous.
He concludes with a heartfelt wish for their futures.
slides.audio: Concluding his speech, Steve Jobs shares the phrase 'Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish' from the Whole Earth Catalog, inspiring graduates to pursue their passions with curiosity and courage. He wishes them success and fulfillment in their journeys.
